utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! New wallet, huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, it was time. The old condom ring in the leather just doesn’t say ‘cool’ anymore.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I know, but the garbage was full.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Have you ever taken out the trash?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I thought you liked doing it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Third door on the left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Hey, MrTreeger.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ummm. Oh! I’m sorry. It’s a little old but…

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: No! You’re clogging up the chute that I spent a half-hour unclogging!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I didn’t—I don’t come in here a lot.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Oh yeah, of course you don’t!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: ‘Cause you’re a little princess! "Daddy, buy me a pizza. Daddy, buy me a candy factory. Daddy, make the cast of Cats sing Happy Birthday to me…"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I didn’t… I never said that.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: You think you could make a mess and the big man in coveralls will come in here and clean it up, huh? Well, why don’t think of someone else for a change?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: God! If you’re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to through it out.]

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s easy for you to say, you weren’t almost just killed.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right that’s it, school is in session!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My God! Is this a gym card?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I’ve missed the last 1200 times.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So why don’t you quit?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don’t think I’ve tried? You think I like having 50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they bring out Maria.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who is Maria?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh Maria. You can’t say no to her, she’s like this lycra spandex covered gym…treat.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So you’re strong enough to face her on your own?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no, you’ll have to come.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Tribbiani! Hold on, I’ll get the plunger.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! You hold on pal! Now you made my friend, Rachel, cry. So now, you’re gonna go up there and apologize to her, unless you want me to call the landlord.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: And tell him what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Have you heard about a little something called, Not Making Girls Cry.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah. Well maybe you have heard about the Rent Stabilization Act of 1968!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I have actually not heard of that.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah, well your friends are in violation of it. I’ve been a nice guy up until now, but uh, I don’t need this grief. I’m gonna call the landlord and tell him that Monica is illegally subletting here grandmother’s apartment. Your friends are outta here pal.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why don’t you tell me something I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh please, somebody tell me I don’t have to go to work today!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, my first massage today is this incredibly gorgeous guy, and every time I see him I just want to do things to him that I’m not allowed to charge for.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So do them for free.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh no, it is forbidden! No-no, Mrs. Potter fires people for fooling around with clients. And it’s against my oath as a masseuse.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: They make you take an oath?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I made myself take an oath. Yeah, no fooling around with clients and umm, always be prepared. Yeah, that one’s actually from the Boy Scouts, but it just makes good sense.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why don’t you just give him to somebody else?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I can handle it. No, I’m a professional.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Pheebs, is that a new ankle bracelet?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because that’s the only part of you he can see when he’s on the table!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re gonna do some feet flirtin’!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t what your talking about.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then how do you explain the toe ring?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Because it’s Arabian princess day at work! Okay?! Leave me alone!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! My hero! What happened?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well uh, I went down there and told him that no one treats my friends like that and that he’d better come up here and apologize. I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What a minute, what did he say?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: He said that he wasn’t gonna apologize because you guys are living here illegally, so instead what he’s gonna do is have you evicted—I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! You got us evicted!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I told you not to go down there!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well he made Rachel cry!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel always cries!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s not true!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like you’ve never sucked before!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right! I’ll try! But if I can’t, you can stay with Chandler and I until you get settled.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Go!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, all right, all right. I mean I’ll have to check with him first, but I’ll think he’ll be cool with it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa, hey! Now remember what we talked about, you gotta be strong.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes. Yes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: One more time, "Hey, don’t you want a washboard stomach and rock hard pecs?"

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! I want a flabby gut and saggy man breasts!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good! That’s good!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. I wanna quit the gym.

utterance.speaker: Gym Employee
utterance.content: You wanna quit?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wanna quit the gym.

utterance.speaker: Gym Employee
utterance.content: You do realize that you won’t have access to our new full service Swedish spa.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wanna quit the gym.

utterance.speaker: Gym Employee
utterance.content: Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. Uh, excuse me, are you a member?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Me? No.

utterance.speaker: Gym Employee
utterance.content: Sorry, members only.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wanna quit the gym.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s okay man, be strong.

utterance.speaker: Gym Employee
utterance.content: So, are you a member of any gym.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! And I’m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.

utterance.speaker: Gym Employee
utterance.content: Okay, no problem. Could you come here for a second?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Maria.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Wow, you have really pretty feet.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: These old things.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it’s been killing me today.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You mean the—Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y'know, the muscles in the siadic area can get y’know, real nice and tight. So umm, tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Ow! Did you just bite me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Please don’t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn’t there fault, it was mine.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: You want me to kick you guys out instead?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No you can’t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: You have pets!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I’m the chick and Chandler is the duck.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Huh, I would’ve thought it was the other way around.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I’ll do whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Really? You’ll do anything?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve got something you can do.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What, what is it?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Can you be my dancing partner?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not, prison lingo, is it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: His dancing partner?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, there’s this superintendent’s dance, the Super Ball. I don’t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he’s a crush on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, why doesn’t he practice with a girl?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, he’s too shy, he doesn’t thing he’s good enough to dance with girls yet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that…garbage chute.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! So, did you quit?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I almost did, couldn’t leave Ross there without a spotter!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait, now so you joined the gym?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And that’s funny, why?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, umm, I was just y’know working out and umm… Oh, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We’re doomed. Okay, they’re gonna take 50 bucks out of our accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you could actually go to the gym.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at the source.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re a genius!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Aww, man, now we won’t be bank buddies!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now, there’s two reasons.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Where?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: On the touchy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And that’s not against your oath?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I know! I-I’m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I’m doing something exciting and I don’t wanna get too excited, I just ahh, y’know try to thing of other things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I’m here, let’s ahh, get this over with.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Okay ahh, well, just ahh, follow my lead.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, don’t we need to do some kinda preparation first? Like ahh, get really drunk?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Look come on, eh, just ah, just ah, put your arms around me, eh.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Ahhhh! I’m sorry!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, it’s okay, but if I’m Marge, my breasts are coming out my back.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Ahh, forget it! I’ll never be any good at this, my mom was right, I’m just a big potato with arms, and legs, and a head.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on man, you’re not a potato.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: I’m sure as hell a dancer, it’s no use Marge will never go for me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on Treeger, don’t say that. You just ahh, you just need more practice. Here, come on, let’s ahh, let’s try it again. Come on. Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y’know, I’m not really that comfortable dancing with a— We-he!! Hey!

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You just did a little dancy thing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes you did! You did like a little hop.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You are soo enjoying this.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I’m not! And it wasn’t a hop it was a pademarie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You know the words! You are so into this!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, well maybe I’m enjoying it a little bit. I mean I’m getting pretty good at it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, this is soo sweet, Joey our little twinkle-toes.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey, hold on, this isn’t some kind of like girly dance. All right, it’s like a sport, it’s manly!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, then show me some manly moves.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know how to lead.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We’d like to close our accounts.

utterance.speaker: Bank Officer
utterance.content: Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, we’d just like to close them.

utterance.speaker: Bank Officer
utterance.content: Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. Would you come over here please?

utterance.speaker: Ms. Lambert
utterance.content: Hi, I’m Karen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wanna quit the bank!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, baseball. Rick, playing baseball. Okay, slides into second, maybe even his pants come down a little… Oh no—wait no, no! No! Okay, all right, sandwiches, sandwiches. Umm, okay, on a plate, maybe Rick’s pants come down a little. No! No! Okay, Chandler! Okay Chandler, ooh, that’s working.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Chandler’s knees. Chandler’s… ankles. Chandler’s ankle hair. Oh no. Okay, you’re all set.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Oh wow! That was amazing, was that really just an hour?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! In… really long hour world.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugh, okay, I have an enormous crush on you. But because you’re a client, I can’t ask you out, even though you give me y’know, the feeling.

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Wow! I had no idea! But you know, I could always find another masseuse.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Yeah, really.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rick
utterance.content: Suddenly, I very aware that I’m naked.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, quit down.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Potter
utterance.content: Mr. Simon’s been waiting for— Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Simon
utterance.content: Why wasn’t I offered that? I’d definitely pay more for that.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Potter
utterance.content: Phoebe, we have rules here, this isn’t that kind of place.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah, oh and I know, but this isn’t what it looks like, ‘cause Rick is my ahh, husband.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Potter
utterance.content: Oh really? Well, then you’d better tell his other wife, ‘cause she called three times asking where he is.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yes, I will tell her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So you didn’t leave the bank?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! And somehow, we ended up with a joint checking account.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What are you ever gonna use that for?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To pay for the gym.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You got fired?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my Gosh!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sweety...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next, y’know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these policemen, thought I was a whore too. It’s been a really bad day, whore wise.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Hey Duck, is Chick here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah… Bunny-rabbit.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you ah, ready for our last practice?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah, but y’know, I think the reason we’re not getting that spin right is because my apartment’s too small.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, you wanna use our place?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: No, I ahh, had another idea.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: We did it!!

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, . Oh my God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well, okay, good luck.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I’m ready to dance with girls.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Go get ‘em Treeger.

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Right. Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: MrTreeger
utterance.content: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she’s the same size as me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I’m good.

utterance.speaker: Interviewer
utterance.content: So it looks like you’ve got some great experience here. Let’s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, they thought I was a whore.

utterance.speaker: Interviewer
utterance.content: Okay, we’ll give a call if anything comes up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great! Thank you very much.
